sanskrit_verse: नष्टं विनष्टं कृमिभिः श्वहतं विषमे मृतम् । हीनं पुरुषकारेण प्रदद्यात्पाल एव तु ॥ ८.२३२॥
transliteration: naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ kṛmibhiḥ śvahataṃ viṣame mṛtam | hīnaṃ puruṣakāreṇa pradadyāt pāla eva tu || 8.232 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: What has been lost, destroyed by worms, seized by dogs, died in battle or poison, or diminished through human effort—such property shall be restored solely by the protector.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority of the Protector to restore what degradation and decay have diminished
Causation rooted in sequential manifestation rather than blame
Capacity-based responsibility aligned with custodial and restorative roles
Restoration logic that bypasses punitive frameworks
Consciousness alignment through reintegration of fragmented or corrupted assets
executable_legal_axioms: IF property_status IN {lost, worm-eaten, dog-seized, battlefield-dead, poisoned, diminished} THEN assign_restoration_duty TO protector
IF agent_contributed_to_diminishment == TRUE THEN initiate_completion_process FOR responsible_party UNDER supervision_of_pāla
IF asset_corruption_detected == TRUE AND no_human_intent_proven THEN default_restoration_action BY state_guardian_entity
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes a threshold where material loss due to natural or circumstantial causes defaults restoration authority to the sovereign guardian. Intent is irrelevant; completion and reintegration are paramount.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that diminishment arises from sequential conditions, not singular fault. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how prior states led to present decay. Proportionality lies in capacity to restore, not punish. Non-punitive reality is upheld as consciousness realigns through reintegration.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate asset tracing and reconstruction protocol under pāla supervision
Engage completion process for all involved parties to assume residual integrity
Deploy consciousness-alignment mechanism for societal memory of ownership continuity
Reintegrate diminished value via systemic resource allocation without assigning culpability
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
